parts.text: {"word":"superimposing","priority":"★★☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"verb (gerund or present participle)","definition":"重ね合わせること、重ねて表示すること","english_definition":"placing or laying one thing over another, typically so that both are still apparent.","examples":[{"sentence":"Superimposing the map onto the aerial photograph helped us find the exact location.","translation":"地図を航空写真に重ね合わせることで、正確な場所を見つけることができました。"},{"sentence":"The artist is known for superimposing different images to create surreal effects.","translation":"そのアーティストは、異なるイメージを重ね合わせてシュールな効果を生み出すことで知られています。"},{"sentence":"The software allows superimposing text onto video.","translation":"そのソフトウェアでは、ビデオにテキストを重ねて表示することができます。"}],"collocations":["superimposing images","superimposing text","superimposing data","superimposing layers","superimposing one thing on another"],"synonyms":["overlaying","overlying","placing over","covering","imposing"],"antonyms":["separating","removing","isolating","distinguishing"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb (gerund or present participle - technical context)","definition":"（幾何学などで）重ねて一致させること","english_definition":"placing one geometric figure on another so that their corresponding parts coincide.","examples":[{"sentence":"Superimposing the two triangles showed that they were congruent.","translation":"2つの三角形を重ね合わせることで、それらが合同であることが示されました。"},{"sentence":"The proof involved superimposing the shapes to demonstrate their similarity.","translation":"その証明には、形状を重ね合わせて類似性を示すことが含まれていました。"}],"collocations":["superimposing triangles","superimposing shapes","geometric superimposing"],"synonyms":["aligning","coinciding","matching","fitting"],"antonyms":["misaligning","separating"]}],"etymology":{"value":"The word 'superimposing' comes from the verb 'superimpose,' which is formed from 'super-' (meaning 'above' or 'over') and 'impose' (meaning 'to place or set on'). The etymology reflects the literal meaning of placing something over something else.","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/ˌsuːpərɪmˈpoʊzɪŋ/","syllables":"su-per-im-pos-ing"},"inflection":{"verb_forms":{"present_simple":["superimpose","superimposes"],"past_simple":"superimposed","past_participle":"superimposed","present_participle":"superimposing"}},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"'Superimposing' refers to the action of placing one thing over another, often in a way that both are still visible or have an effect. It's commonly used in contexts involving images, videos, maps, and data visualization. In technical fields like geometry, it can refer to placing figures on top of each other to demonstrate congruence or similarity. The term implies a deliberate act of layering or combining elements.","priority":"★★★"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"✗ superimposing the picture by the video","correct":"✓ superimposing the picture on the video","note":"The correct preposition to use with 'superimpose' is 'on' or 'onto'."},{"incorrect":"✗ superimposing and overlapping are the same in every context.","correct":"✓ While superimposing involves overlapping, it often implies a specific purpose of combining or layering elements, whereas overlapping can be more general.","note":"While related, superimposing often implies a deliberate combination or layering, whereas overlapping can be a more general term for covering part of something."}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["superimpose (verb)","superimposition (noun)","superimposed (adjective)"],"phrasal_verbs":[],"priority":"★★★"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"C1","frequency_google_ngram":"Relatively infrequent, but common in technical and visual arts contexts.","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"C1","text":"'Superimposing' means to place or lay one thing over another, often so that both are still visible or have an effect. This word is often used in technical contexts, such as image editing, video production, and data analysis, where layers of information are combined. Understanding the concept is important for comprehending how different elements can be combined to create a composite view or effect. The word implies a deliberate act of layering or combining elements, rather than simply overlapping them.","example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The architect was superimposing the new design onto the existing building plans.","translation":"建築家は新しいデザインを既存の建築設計図に重ね合わせていました。","type":"verb (present participle)","meaning_category":"重ね合わせる"},{"sentence":"By superimposing different datasets, we could identify correlations that were not apparent before.","translation":"異なるデータセットを重ね合わせることで、以前は明らかでなかった相関関係を特定できました。","type":"verb (present participle)","meaning_category":"重ね合わせる"},{"sentence":"The software is capable of superimposing subtitles onto the movie in real-time.","translation":"そのソフトウェアは、映画にリアルタイムで字幕を重ねて表示することができます。","type":"verb (present participle)","meaning_category":"重ねて表示する"}]}
